title: Logan Paul challenged Conor McGregor to an MMA fight after his boxing rematch with KSI: 'He's f------ punching old men in the face'
text:
Logan Paul has challenged Conor McGregor to a fight — and it's not the first time.

Just over a year ago, Paul and his younger brother, Jake, were gearing up to fight the fellow YouTubers KSI and his brother, Deji.

Speaking with TMZ at Los Angeles International Airport, the younger Paul said: "I think it'd be dope to see one of us fight McGregor," to which his brother responded, "That's what I was thinking!"

"We've got to prove ourselves first," Logan Paul said.

The headline fight between Paul and KSI ended in a majority draw, generating as much as $11 million for the two fighters.

KSI and Paul fought in August 2018. Reuters

Earlier this month, a rematch without headgear was confirmed for November 9 at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, and Paul has once again expressed his interest in entering the octagon and fighting McGregor.

Read more: KSI and Logan Paul won't stream their boxing fight on YouTube because of piracy worries

Ahead of a press conference with KSI, Paul was asked by Fight Hub TV who McGregor should fight next.

"Me," he replied. "I swear to God, yeah, I'll fight Conor. He's f------ punching old men in the face."

McGregor issued an apology on ESPN after footage of his throwing a punch at an older man in a Dublin pub was shared by TMZ in August.

"He did take it though!" Paul said. "He took the punch and then just drank his whiskey. Those Irishmen dude, those Irishmen ... wild."

Paul added that he was "obsessed" with MMA. "No offense to Eddie, I'm an MMA fan," he said of the boxing promoter Eddie Hearn. "I want to do MMA after this. I wrestled in high school."

While the YouTuber might fancy his chances against McGregor, it doesn't look as if he'll be challenging the man who beat the Irishman most recently — Khabib Nurmagomedov — anytime soon.

"I don't think Khabib's a human being," Logan said. "I don't know where he came from, but in my eyes he's unbeatable," he continued, going on to mention Nurmagomedov's bout against Dustin Poirier earlier this month.

"Like, no offense to Dustin, but I didn't think Dustin would win and look what happened — it was pure domination."

McGregor announced his retirement from MMA earlier this year, but his return has been hinted at by the UFC boss, Dana White. It remains unclear whether he will actually fight again.
description: History is repeating itself as Paul previously challenged McGregor ahead of his first fight with KSI. Now, ahead of the rematch, he's done it again.
